condition.description:
Tremors are unintentional trembling or shaking movements in one or more parts of your body. Most tremors occur in the hands. You can also have arm, head, face, vocal cord, trunk, and leg tremors. Tremors are most common in middle-aged and older people, but anyone can have them.

The cause of tremors is a problem in the parts of the brain that control muscles in the body or in specific parts of the body, such as the hands. They commonly occur in otherwise healthy people. They may also be caused by problems such as

  • Parkinson's disease
  • Dystonia
  • Multiple sclerosis
  • Stroke
  • Traumatic brain injury
  • Alcohol abuse and withdrawal
  • Certain medicines

Some forms are inherited and run in families. Others have no known cause.

There is no cure for most tremors. Treatment to relieve them depends on their cause. In many cases, medicines and sometimes surgical procedures can reduce or stop tremors and improve muscle control. Tremors are not life threatening. However, they can be embarrassing and make it hard to perform daily tasks.

NIH: National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke
condition.name: Tremor

basics.benefits_moa: Propranolol is an alpha and beta blocker. It lowers blood pressure by slowing heart rate, relaxing blood vessels, and lowering the body's fight-or-flight response.
basics.bottom_line: Propranolol is good for treating many heart problems and other problems in the body, but it has more side effects than other beta blockers. You can't miss doses.
downsides: Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.
Has more side effects than some beta blockers because it crosses into the brain and central nervous system.

Not a first-choice treatment for high blood pressure according to the latest guidelines, except if you have heart failure or heart disease. As a second choice, your doctor might add it to medicines you're already taking if your blood pressure is still too high.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Propranolol suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

downsides_processed.orig: Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.
Has more side effects than some beta blockers because it crosses into the brain and central nervous system.

Not a first-choice treatment for high blood pressure according to the latest guidelines, except if you have heart failure or heart disease. As a second choice, your doctor might add it to medicines you're already taking if your blood pressure is still too high.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Propranolol suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

upsides: A first-choice treatment to prevent chest pain (angina).
A first-choice treatment for heart failure, heart attack, heart valve disorders, and abnormal heart rhythm.
Also treats and prevents many non-heart problems, such as tremors, anxiety, migraines, and liver disease symptoms.

upsides_processed.orig: A first-choice treatment to prevent chest pain (angina).
A first-choice treatment for heart failure, heart attack, heart valve disorders, and abnormal heart rhythm.
Also treats and prevents many non-heart problems, such as tremors, anxiety, migraines, and liver disease symptoms.

drugs.one_liner: Lowers blood pressure and controls heart rate.

userStories.tip: Nausea, dizziness and loss of energy.
I actually take it for essential tremor. It works very well. My hands no longer shake which is great.
The worst side effects for me...threw me into a deep depression. Horrendous.
I take it for occasional stage fright.

I've used it for public speaking, it works great totally stops irrriating hand or voice shakes. However; I experienced sudden dizziness after getting up quickly after a period of long period of sitting.
took this to manage shakes from lithium. it worked pretty well.

no issue; take as low of a dose as possible, remember to not skip doses, and prepare for a day when you don't need to take it any longer. completely stopped my anxiety from lasting more than a couple of minutes.
I started taking it for migraine prevention, but then found it completely rid me of my stage fright and issues with public speaking.
I'm taking very short amounts for anxiety since my doctor wants me to calm down but doesn't want to give me any drug that would mess up with my brain. It's working great!
Take it only when you need. It reduces the physical symptoms of anxiety, such as sweating, but it does not help with the mental aspect of anxiety

carousel_items_processed.orig: Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Can cause insomnia and fatigue.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar. Be careful if you're diabetic.
Don't stop taking this medicine suddenly.

risks_warnings.title: Increased chest pain or risk of heart attack
risks_warnings.description: Do not stop taking Propranolol suddenly without talking to your doctor as chest pain or angina may become increased. Stopping Propranolol suddenly may start a heart attack. Talk to your doctor if you are interested in stopping this medication.

description_processed.orig: Do not stop taking Propranolol suddenly without talking to your doctor as chest pain or angina may become increased. Stopping Propranolol suddenly may start a heart attack. Talk to your doctor if you are interested in stopping this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Heart failure
risks_warnings.description: Cases of heart failure due to taking Propranolol have been reported. Tell your doctor if you noticed increased swelling around your legs or ankles, sudden weight gain or sudden shortness of breath as these may be symptoms of heart failure.

description_processed.orig: Cases of heart failure due to taking Propranolol have been reported. Tell your doctor if you noticed increased swelling around your legs or ankles, sudden weight gain or sudden shortness of breath as these may be symptoms of heart failure.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risks during surgery
risks_warnings.description: If you are planning to undergo major surgery requiring anesthesia, tell your surgeon that you are on Propranolol, so that they can monitor your heart more closely.

description_processed.orig: If you are planning to undergo major surgery requiring anesthesia, tell your surgeon that you are on Propranolol, so that they can monitor your heart more closely.

risks_warnings.title: Masked symptoms of low blood sugar
risks_warnings.description: Patients on Propranolol who are also diabetic may not recognize symptoms of low blood sugar, except for sweating and dizziness. Talk to your doctor about when to monitor your blood sugar if you are started on Propranolol.

description_processed.orig: Patients on Propranolol who are also diabetic may not recognize symptoms of low blood sugar, except for sweating and dizziness. Talk to your doctor about when to monitor your blood sugar if you are started on Propranolol.

risks_warnings.title: Masked symptoms of overactive thyroid
risks_warnings.description: Patients on Propranolol who also have an overactive thyroid may not recognize signs of hyperthyroidism, such as fast heart rate. Also, do not stop taking Propranolol suddenly without consulting your doctor, as this may start a thyroid storm.

description_processed.orig: Patients on Propranolol who also have an overactive thyroid may not recognize signs of hyperthyroidism, such as fast heart rate. Also, do not stop taking Propranolol suddenly without consulting your doctor, as this may start a thyroid storm.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: You may notice a slowing of your heart rate when you take this medication. You may experience dizziness when you first take the medication. Be careful when getting up from either lying down or sitting to avoid falls. Also tell your doctor if your heart rate goes below 55 beats per minute as they may consider changing your dose. Your doctor may monitor your heart rate and rhythm.
risk_factors: Concurrent use of non-dihydropyridine calcium channel blockers, digoxin or clonidine

description_processed.orig: You may notice a slowing of your heart rate when you take this medication. You may experience dizziness when you first take the medication. Be careful when getting up from either lying down or sitting to avoid falls. Also tell your doctor if your heart rate goes below 55 beats per minute as they may consider changing your dose. Your doctor may monitor your heart rate and rhythm.

risks_warnings.title: Serious skin reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rare reports of skin rash have been reported which may be considered serious to life-threatening. If you notice a sudden severe skin rash with a fever, call your doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Rare reports of skin rash have been reported which may be considered serious to life-threatening. If you notice a sudden severe skin rash with a fever, call your doctor immediately.

basics.benefits_moa: Clonazepam is a fast-acting benzodiazepine. It affects neurotransmitters in the brain and calms the nervous system. This reduces anxiety and muscle spasms, and causes sleepiness.
basics.bottom_line: Clonazepam is okay for occasional or short-term use (up to 4 weeks) for anxiety, and to treat seizures. Less severe withdrawal symptoms compared to similar drugs.
downsides: Can cause memory problems, drowsiness, dizziness, and confusion.
Can be habit-forming, so it's not typically used for long-term treatment, or for people who've had problems with drug or alcohol abuse.
Most people find that it gets less effective over time.

downsides_processed.orig: Can cause memory problems, drowsiness, dizziness, and confusion.
Can be habit-forming, so it's not typically used for long-term treatment, or for people who've had problems with drug or alcohol abuse.
Most people find that it gets less effective over time.

upsides: Effective at relieving short-term anxiety and sleeplessness.
Can be used together with antidepressants to manage anxiety disorders. Especially helpful for anxiety symptoms while you wait for an antidepressant to kick in (it can take several weeks).
Can be used alone or with other medicines to treat seizures.
Less severe withdrawal symptoms compared to other benzodiazepines.

upsides_processed.orig: Effective at relieving short-term anxiety and sleeplessness.
Can be used together with antidepressants to manage anxiety disorders. Especially helpful for anxiety symptoms while you wait for an antidepressant to kick in (it can take several weeks).
Can be used alone or with other medicines to treat seizures.
Less severe withdrawal symptoms compared to other benzodiazepines.

drugs.one_liner: Controls seizures and helps you relax.

userStories.tip: It made me very sleepy and relaxed when I first took it but it relieved anxious feelings on the spot. Works way better than Xanax for me.. Plus it lasts longer

userStories.identifier: School student with panic and bipolar
userStories.tip: Klonopin has effectively eliminated panic from my life. I still have obsessive thoughts, but I'm aware of them and can file them to the back of my mind. Using it for more than a few weeks though has caused me to experience withdrawal.

userStories.identifier: I have approx 8 diff kinds of arthritisr
userStories.tip: heat & weight help a little such as 7-8 blankets

Tbh, I used Klonopin for benzo withdrawal. I was hooked on Xanax for about a year taking up to 6mg daily. So I went to my pshyc doctor and shared my problem. She Rx'd me Klonopin to taper off. Now I'm 100% benzo free!
First week may cause tiredness and/or fatigue. After 5-7 days if consecutive use (2-3 times a day) this will subside substantially.

Klonopin caused extreme anxiety, panic attacks, violence, increased suicide attempts to escape adverse reactions, alcohol use, caused agoraphobia. Withdrawals almost killed me. Very dangerous drug. Highly addicting.

Very good medication. Xanax makes me feel 'druggy'... Valium is also good, but seems a little less potent than Klonopin. Klonopin imo, is right in between Xanax and Valium. Klonopin is the best benzodiazepine.
Don't drink.

I take three one mg a day, I was plagued with anxiety from age 10, I was a mess and took tranzine for years, then xanax which I took way to much, had high tolerance fast, was hell coming off, started 3 1mg , hard coming off but I'm a lifer

Klonopin is a medication that one uses on a regular basis to keep anxiety or manic phases at bay.  It can take up to an hour to feel its effects and when first starting, it takes a few days to really become effective.

userStories.identifier: Social Anxiety w/SS on Autism spectrum
userStories.tip: It took me a long time to realize that I experienced long term memory loss related to taking clonazepam.  Clonazepam reduces my IQ by about 10 points.  It reduces my ability to think and learn.

userStories.identifier: Field Technican, 52 years old with GAD
userStories.tip: Take as needed to avoid tolerance.
Took v low dose.  Saw no side effects and it helped quiet the teeth grinding and tightness in my stomach
Once you're on it at a daily dose, for more than 2 months, going off will be very very difficult. Google "Clonazepam" withdrawl.

I used it to get back to sleep when I woke u at 4 am, which was regularly. I also used it for high intensity moments which triggered anxiety. Careful not to go over 1.5 mg a day; it is a bit insidious in how the dosage creeps up.
Not for sudden anxiety attacks, but can help keep a baseline to prevent both my panic attacks and control mania with bipolar disorder.
userStories.identifier: Dx w/ Bipolar Type 1 and ADHD.

userStories.tip: If taking 2 or 3 times daily, make sure to take them at the timed intervals (every 6 hours, every 12 hours, etc.). Missing these time frames by more than two hours can really effect you and you don't physically feel it 'wear off'.

Actually began taking this for KNOTS in tummy and IBS. Worked off the bat. Been on it for 20 years and keeps me able to work and socialize. DON"T run out or quit, the withdrawals are horrible, worse than most Pain Pills, I know, been there.
Works great for staying asleep, but its impossible to stop taking it once you're hooked.  Very addictive
It takes a bit to kick in, so it works best as a now-and-then pill for when you're going to be in a situation you know makes you anxious.
Take it in the evening before you go to sleep, it keeps you even throughout the next day. Make sure to not take it too late, otherwise drowsiness can occur in the AM

Warning! Although Klonopin and other benzos work well to relax you, they cause PHYSICAL dependence. I was on a low dose (1 mg) and it took me a year to get off of it. A BMJ article (9/2014) says that benzo use causes dementia. Stay away!
userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping

userStories.identifier: Laid back with type A moments
userStories.tip: It works great for me although it is definitely addictive.  Many sources report that you need to take higher dosages for the same effect over time, but that has not been the case with me.  I love what this medication does for me.

It worked for a few months and then turned on me. Caused more symptoms and the ones it was meant to prevent came back worse than ever.  It took over two years to taper even though the doc said I could quit in a few weeks.  Off five months and still not healed yet.  Look up benzo withdrawal syndrome on Wiki.  If I helped one person I feel good.  This is POISON!
userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping

userStories.tip: If you are taking it long-term, try to take as low a dose as possible. Withdrawl after long-term use is extremely unpleasant.
userStories.identifier: Parent, works in software, wife/2 kids

userStories.tip: Obviously, a fast acting benzo is going to be "overall worth it". It stops the panic. It stops the bodily sensations of oncoming panic attacks. It makes life bearable after being traumatized.
Dosage and timing is everything with Clonazepam.  Start off at 1 mg and evaluate from there. Also take at least and 90 minutes before you need it to start working.
userStories.identifier: Easy going and a team player.

carousel_items_processed.orig: For the first week, avoid activities that require you to be alert.
Can cause dizziness, drowsiness, and salivation.
Report any confusion or inability to control muscle movements to your doctor.
Not safe to use with alcohol.

risks_warnings.title: Tolerance and dependence
risks_warnings.description: If you use Clonazepam for 4 weeks or more, it's likely that your body will develop tolerance to it, which means that more and more of the medication is needed to achieve the same effect. You're also likely to become physically dependent on the medication, which means that you'll feel withdrawal symptoms if you stop taking it all at once. You can avoid withdrawal by weaning off of the medication very slowly with the help of a doctor. Take only the prescribed dose to minimize risks of abuse and overdose. Clonazepam should not be used by people with a history of drug abuse if an alternative medication is available.
risk_factors: Taking more than the prescribed dose

description_processed.orig: If you use Clonazepam for 4 weeks or more, it's likely that your body will develop tolerance to it, which means that more and more of the medication is needed to achieve the same effect. You're also likely to become physically dependent on the medication, which means that you'll feel withdrawal symptoms if you stop taking it all at once. You can avoid withdrawal by weaning off of the medication very slowly with the help of a doctor. Take only the prescribed dose to minimize risks of abuse and overdose. Clonazepam should not be used by people with a history of drug abuse if an alternative medication is available.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Clonazepam suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and muscle pain or burning. Withdrawal symptoms can last 6 weeks or longer. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose when stopping or switching to a different medication.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Clonazepam suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and muscle pain or burning. Withdrawal symptoms can last 6 weeks or longer. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose when stopping or switching to a different medication.

risks_warnings.title: Pregnancy
risks_warnings.description: Clonazepam can harm a developing fetus. The baby can become dependent on the medicine and go through withdrawal after birth. Don't use Clonazepam while pregnant.

description_processed.orig: Clonazepam can harm a developing fetus. The baby can become dependent on the medicine and go through withdrawal after birth. Don't use Clonazepam while pregnant.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Clonazepam impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. These effects can extend to the morning after taking Clonazepam. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Clonazepam impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. These effects can extend to the morning after taking Clonazepam. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Memory problems
risks_warnings.description: Your brain may have difficulty making new memories while you're taking Clonazepam.

description_processed.orig: Your brain may have difficulty making new memories while you're taking Clonazepam.

Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.

basics.benefits_moa: Metoprolol tartrate is a beta blocker. It lowers blood pressure by slowing heart rate, relaxing blood vessels, and lowering the body's fight-or-flight response.
basics.bottom_line: Metoprolol tartrate is good for controlling chest pain and treating heart failure and heart attack. You have to take it with food, and you can't miss doses.
downsides: Metoprolol tartrate is the immediate release version of Toprol XL. You have to take Metoprolol tartrate with food for it to work best. (On the other hand, you can take Toprol XL any time.)
Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.

Not a first-choice treatment for high blood pressure according to the latest guidelines, except if you have heart failure or heart disease. As a second choice, your doctor might add it to medicines you're already taking if your blood pressure is still too high.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Metoprolol tartrate suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

downsides_processed.orig: Metoprolol tartrate is the immediate release version of Toprol XL. You have to take Metoprolol tartrate with food for it to work best. (On the other hand, you can take Toprol XL any time.)
Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.

Not a first-choice treatment for high blood pressure according to the latest guidelines, except if you have heart failure or heart disease. As a second choice, your doctor might add it to medicines you're already taking if your blood pressure is still too high.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Metoprolol tartrate suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

upsides: A first-choice treatment to prevent chest pain (angina). Makes pain attacks less frequent and makes it easier to be active without having chest pain.
A first-choice treatment for heart failure. May prevent long-term heart damage.
A first-choice treatment for heart attack. Lowers the risk of death during and after a heart attack.

upsides_processed.orig: A first-choice treatment to prevent chest pain (angina). Makes pain attacks less frequent and makes it easier to be active without having chest pain.
A first-choice treatment for heart failure. May prevent long-term heart damage.

drugs.one_liner: Lowers blood pressure and controls heart rate.

userStories.tip: it's never given me any problems or dramatic side effects.

Had to try different Metoprolol dosages and then also added Losartan to finally settle on a regime that has kept my blood pressure under control and stable for over 10 years with little side effects. Definitely worth it.
userStories.identifier: HBP and mild heart attack 15 years ago.

userStories.tip: I don't like the fatigue it causes. I've been taking this medication for 6 weeks and it's difficult for me to work out. I do not have the endurance I had before starting this medication. It makes me sluggish and tired.
Schedule dosage at well before activity.  Will sometimes cause drowsiness within an hour for about a half an hour

risks_warnings.title: Masked symptoms of low blood sugar
risks_warnings.description: Patients on Metoprolol tartrate who are also diabetic may not recognize symptoms of low blood sugar, except for sweating and dizziness. Talk to your doctor about when to monitor your blood sugar if you are started on Metoprolol tartrate.

description_processed.orig: Patients on Metoprolol tartrate who are also diabetic may not recognize symptoms of low blood sugar, except for sweating and dizziness. Talk to your doctor about when to monitor your blood sugar if you are started on Metoprolol tartrate.

risks_warnings.title: Masked symptoms of overactive thyroid
risks_warnings.description: Patients on Metoprolol tartrate who also have overactive thyroid may not recognize the signs of hyperthyroidism, such as fast heart rate. Don't stop taking Metoprolol tartrate suddenly without talking to your doctor, since this can cause worse thyroid problems.

description_processed.orig: Patients on Metoprolol tartrate who also have overactive thyroid may not recognize the signs of hyperthyroidism, such as fast heart rate. Don't stop taking Metoprolol tartrate suddenly without talking to your doctor, since this can cause worse thyroid problems.

risks_warnings.title: Heart attack
risks_warnings.description: Don't stop taking Metoprolol tartrate suddenly without talking to your doctor if you have coronary artery disease, since chest pain (angina) can increase suddenly or trigger a heart attack.

description_processed.orig: Don't stop taking Metoprolol tartrate suddenly without talking to your doctor if you have coronary artery disease, since chest pain (angina) can increase suddenly or trigger a heart attack.

risks_warnings.title: Increased symptoms of heart failure
risks_warnings.description: Worsening symptoms of heart failure, such as increased swelling in your arms and legs, can occur if your doctor decides to increase your dosage of Metoprolol tartrate. Your doctor can work with you to minimize these effects.

description_processed.orig: Worsening symptoms of heart failure, such as increased swelling in your arms and legs, can occur if your doctor decides to increase your dosage of Metoprolol tartrate. Your doctor can work with you to minimize these effects.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risks during surgery
risks_warnings.description: If you're planning to undergo a major surgery requiring anesthesia, tell your surgeon that you are on Metoprolol tartrate, so they can monitor your heart closely.

risks_warnings.title: Trouble breathing (bronchospastic disease)
risks_warnings.description: Metoprolol tartrate has a beta blocker (metoprolol) that is generally not recommended for people with bronchospastic disease, like asthma, because it can trigger difficulty breathing. Metoprolol tartrate should only be used under careful supervision of a doctor.

carousel_items: For the first week, avoid activities that require you to be alert.
Don't use if pregnant.
Can cause tingling skin sensations and reduced appetite.
Report any confusion, decreased sweating, fever, or changes in behavior or vision.
Takes 3 to 4 weeks to feel full effects on mood.

clock.tip: Works slower when taken with food.

basics.benefits_moa: Topamax is an antiepileptic. Researchers don't know exactly how it works, but it seems to affect multiple parts of the brain to control seizures and migraines.
basics.bottom_line: Topamax is useful for preventing seizures and migraines, and doesn't require blood tests while you're on it.
downsides: Can cause sleepiness, speech problems, tingling sensations, and weight loss.
A few people will get kidney stones.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

downsides_processed.orig: Can cause sleepiness, speech problems, tingling sensations, and weight loss.
A few people will get kidney stones.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

upsides: Used on its own or with other antiepileptic medicines to lower the frequency of seizures, especially for people with tonic-clonic or partial seizures, or Lennox-Gestaut syndrome.
Helpful in preventing frequent migraine headaches.

upsides_processed.orig: Used on its own or with other antiepileptic medicines to lower the frequency of seizures, especially for people with tonic-clonic or partial seizures, or Lennox-Gestaut syndrome.
Helpful in preventing frequent migraine headaches.

userStories.tip: Went from 4-5 migraines a week to 1-2 a month.  Have the tingling and did experiencing weight loss; tingling in feet comes and goes, never completely gone for years now.  Overall would take the 'pins and needles' over a migraine.

userStories.identifier: full time employee, part time student
userStories.tip: Caused abdominal pain, diarrhea and weight loss for the first month.  Caused cognitive problems - couldn't concentrate and would completely blank on certain words, specifically names.
This works better than any of the anti-depressants I've tried (even though they're not in the same category) and the weight loss is a nice bonus!

Taken for 3 years & have finally found the best balance of keeping my old 400mg daily dosage but split up twice a day (morning & night) to avoid the dreaded "DOPE-A-MAX" as my Doctor hilariously calls the word finding brain fog side effect.

Still get migraines but they're tolerable headaches usually and don't even require pain meds. Tingling subsided after a couple of months. Minor brain fog worth the migraine abatement. Don't mind the weight loss either.

I really took for bipolar but helps w sezuire which I had too but I stop cause it made me unstable on feet I fell few times ...had Brian fog ...I blackout few times not worth it there other treatments for both never work on the pain
Worked great for my migraines but the side effects out weighed the pros. Tingling all over, loss of appetite, I couldn't taste and anything carbonated tasted flat, and on and off brain fog.

Pros:  50 mg Topamax per day seemed to make my 3-6 migraines per month shallower, shorter, and less painful.  I also lost weight - nice!  However, I stopped taking it after a year because it was making me too tired and depressed.
Definitely reduced my appetite, but for me it's absolutely worth it for the almost perfect migraine prevention.
I take it for MS-associated nerve pain, not diabetes, but the option wasn't there. Be careful about dosage, especially if you're taking with other meds that make you sleepy.

userStories.identifier: active young professional with no kids
userStories.tip: When I started taking Topamax I was only on 50mg a day but after being on it for over a year I need to take 100mg for it to work well for me.

I take it in the evening, since it makes me sleepy - and since I have to take it daily, at the same time, I just synced it with my birth control pill. Easy-peasy.

So far it's drastically reduced my migraines. Tingly feet, though.
Topamax reduces number of full blown migraines.  Results in low energy and slower mental functions.  Till have to take nine abortives each month.
userStories.identifier: 77 year old male with low energy.

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: I took Topamax for a year for seizures. While it worked (I didn't have any seizures until I cut my dose myself), I was living in an endless brain fog. My family said I was like a zombie. I had no ambition or emotion.
Taking it in the evening helped with fatigue. Tingling was worth the decrease in migraines.

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: This was the drug I will never use again for migraines. It doesn't work and has too many side effects.
I have been taking this medicine for a decade without any problems
Start with low dose but you have to increase over time
Felt absolutely terrible for first week on this stuff. After that, I felt completely normal again. Kick-started my stalled weight loss.
Took for 6 months for migraines. Had same amount of migraine if not more. Horrible pain in my arms. Severe brain fog. Couldn't stand the side effects even if the drug had worked.
userStories.identifier: Migraines over 20 years. High stress job
wife, happy, travel and enjoy friends
userStories.tip: take one at night, one in the morning

1-It will affect concentration so take at night
2- It will affect your kidneys so get bloodwork done regularly
3- It will affect your mood at high doses

drugs.name: Topamax

carousel_items_processed.orig: For the first week, avoid activities that require you to be alert.
Don't use if pregnant.
Can cause tingling skin sensations and reduced appetite.
Report any confusion, decreased sweating, fever, or changes in behavior or vision.
Takes 3 to 4 weeks to feel full effects on mood.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Topamax may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Topamax may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Pregnancy
risks_warnings.description: Topamax may cause birth defects. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Topamax may cause birth defects. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

risks_warnings.title: Uncontrolled body temperature
risks_warnings.description: Topamax can cause high body temperature and decreased sweating. Monitor your body temperature during strenuous exercise or exposure to high outside temperatures.

description_processed.orig: Topamax can cause high body temperature and decreased sweating. Monitor your body temperature during strenuous exercise or exposure to high outside temperatures.

risks_warnings.title: Mental changes due to high ammonia
risks_warnings.description: Topamax may cause increased ammonia in the body. Tell your doctor if you notice any confusion, weakness, or vomiting.

description_processed.orig: Topamax may cause increased ammonia in the body. Tell your doctor if you notice any confusion, weakness, or vomiting.

risks_warnings.title: Kidney stones
risks_warnings.description: Topamax may increase your risk for kidney stones. Stay well-hydrated to lower your risk.

description_processed.orig: Topamax may increase your risk for kidney stones. Stay well-hydrated to lower your risk.

risks_warnings.title: Vision problems
risks_warnings.description: Topamax can cause eye pain, blurry vision, or narrow vision. Vision problems can happen any time while taking this medication. Tell your doctor if you have any changes in your vision.

description_processed.orig: Topamax can cause eye pain, blurry vision, or narrow vision. Vision problems can happen any time while taking this medication. Tell your doctor if you have any changes in your vision.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal seizures
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Topamax suddenly can increase the number of seizures. If you want to stop taking Topamax, talk to your doctor before making any changes. Itâ€™s safer to slowly lower your dose of the drug over at least one week before completely stopping.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Topamax suddenly can increase the number of seizures. If you want to stop taking Topamax, talk to your doctor before making any changes. Itâ€™s safer to slowly lower your dose of the drug over at least one week before completely stopping.

surveys.question: Besides medications, what else has worked for you?
Whatâ€™s your best coping strategy?
surveys.tip: Accepting that I will live with this for the rest of my life. Accepting that and insisting on enjoying life anyways. Doing things that I want to experience helps me cope

surveys.question: Besides medications, what else has worked for you?
